titlestmt.subtitle: Papers, 1929-1978, of Carleton Smith at the Lilly Library, Indiana University, Bloomington, Indiana
titlestmt.author: Electronic finding aid encoded by Beth Benda.

XML finding aid derived from HTML version through cutting and pasting.

titlepage.titleproper: Guide to the Smith, C. mss., 1929-1978
titlepage.publisher: Lilly Library, Indiana University, Bloomington, Indiana
titlepage.p: © 2003 Trustees of Indiana University. All rights reserved.

did.head: Summary Information
did.abstract: Consists of the papers of educator, consultant, musicologist, and journalist Carleton Smith, 1908-1984.

accessrestrict.head: Access Restrictions
accessrestrict.p: This collection is open for research.

userestrict.head: Usage Restrictions
userestrict.p: Prior arrangements are not necessary before coming to the Library, however, patrons from out of town are encouraged to communicate with the Library in advance of their visits to ascertain availability of materials.
Photocopying permitted only with permission of the Curator of Manuscripts, Lilly Library.

prefercite.head: Preferred Citation
prefercite.p: [Item], Smith, C. mss., Lilly Library, Indiana University, Bloomington, Indiana.

bioghist.head: Biographical Note
bioghist.p: Smith was the director of the National Arts Foundation and organized the International Awards Foundation to establish awards in fields not covered by the Nobel Prize. Smith was instrumental in establishing the Pritzker Prize for architecture and the Getty Wildlife Conservation Prize. He taught music appreciation at the University of Illinois from 1926 to 1929, economics and foreign trade at De Paul University from 1928 to 1934, and music history at Oxford University from 1931 to 1939. He was the music editor of Esquire and was European correspondent for the New York Herald Tribune. During the late 1940's he helped recover many music manuscripts that were lost during the war. Through his extensive travels Smith befriended many politicians, musicians and other luminaries of his day.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Content Note
scopecontent.p: Consist of the papers of educator, consultant, musicologist, and journalist Carleton Smith, 1908-1984. Included are a collection of transcripts and notes for articles for Esquire and other magazines; photographs of various celebrities and public figures; correspondence involving the Nobel Prize and the Pritzker Prize, as well as with various celebrities, politicians, musicians, and other public figures, such as Joan Crawford, Dwight D. Eisenhower, J. Paul Getty, Lyndon B. Johnson, Jean Sibelius, and Thomas Merton.

altformavail.head: Additional Physical Form Available
altformavail.p: Some audio materials have been reformatted for use in the repository only.

arrangement.head: Arrangement/Organization
arrangement.p: Organized into the following series: I. Business/Professional; II. Writings; III. Personal; IV. Miscellaneous; V. Mixed Media.

controlaccess.head: Indexing Terms
controlaccess.p: The following terms have been used to index the description of this collection in IUCAT, the IU Libraries' online catalog. Materials about related topics, persons or places can be found by searching the catalog using these terms.

scopecontent.p: Contains correspondence and other materials relating to Smith's career. Arranged alphabetically by subject. Subject headings are taken for the most part from original folder labels, followed by date span of materials and the contents of each folder.
